text: 24 Jan 2025 Rising Strong: 6 Life-Changing Stories of Struggle and Success Life’s challenges have a way of shaping us, testing our limits, and teaching us what it means to truly persevere. In Rising Strong: 6 Life-Changing Stories of Struggle and Success, we explore remarkable memoirs and biographies that dive deep into the resilience of the human spirit. These stories are more than tales of survival—they’re blueprints for overcoming adversity, finding purpose, and emerging stronger on the other side. Whether you’re seeking inspiration or a reminder of the power of hope, these books are sure to leave a lasting impression. Suddenly Silent and Still by Nin Mok Release Date: January 15 2025 Mok’s inspiring and heartfelt memoir, told with honesty and humor, demonstrates the power of reframing adversity when one’s situation cannot be changed. A sudden medical trauma forces Mok’s driven lifestyle to a standstill, sparking profound introspection on life’s meaning and purpose. Buy on Amazon Dare I Say It by Naomi Watts Release Date: January 21 2025 Irreverent, bold, and reassuring, Dare I Say It is the companion every woman needs to embrace the best version of herself as she moves into what can be the most powerful and satisfying period of her life. Buy on Amazon Go Higher by Big Sean Release Date: January 21 2025 Multi-platinum artist, entrepreneur, and philanthropist, Big Sean shares his five key practices for inner work and self-acceptance in this interactive guidebook on maintaining daily mental wellness. Buy on Amazon Three Wild Dogs (and the truth) by Markus Zusak Release Date: January 21 2025 In this poignant, funny, and disarmingly honest memoir, one of the world’s most beloved storytellers, the #1 New York Times bestselling author of The Book Thief, tells of his family’s adoption of three troublesome rescue dogs—a charming and courageous love story about making even the most incorrigible of animals family. Buy on Amazon This Changes Everything by Tyler Merritt Release Date: January 14 2025 A cancer diagnosis caused Tyler Merritt—beloved author of I Take My Coffee Black—to realize that there was no time for anger, unforgiveness, foolishness, or lost friendships. None of us have any time to waste. Buy on Amazon The Good Mother Myth by Nancy Reddy Release Date: January 21 2025 Timely and thought-provoking, Nancy Reddy unpacks and debunks the bad ideas that have for too long defined what it means to be a “good” mom. html:
24 Jan 2025

Rising Strong: 6 Life-Changing Stories of Struggle and Success

Life’s challenges have a way of shaping us, testing our limits, and teaching us what it means to truly persevere. In Rising Strong: 6 Life-Changing Stories of Struggle and Success, we explore remarkable memoirs and biographies that dive deep into the resilience of the human spirit. These stories are more than tales of survival—they’re blueprints for overcoming adversity, finding purpose, and emerging stronger on the other side. Whether you’re seeking inspiration or a reminder of the power of hope, these books are sure to leave a lasting impression.

Suddenly Silent and Still

by Nin Mok

Release Date: January 15 2025

Mok’s inspiring and heartfelt memoir, told with honesty and humor, demonstrates the power of reframing adversity when one’s situation cannot be changed. A sudden medical trauma forces Mok’s driven lifestyle to a standstill, sparking profound introspection on life’s meaning and purpose.

Buy on Amazon

Dare I Say It

by Naomi Watts

Release Date: January 21 2025

Irreverent, bold, and reassuring, Dare I Say It is the companion every woman needs to embrace the best version of herself as she moves into what can be the most powerful and satisfying period of her life.

Buy on Amazon

Go Higher

by Big Sean

Release Date: January 21 2025

Multi-platinum artist, entrepreneur, and philanthropist, Big Sean shares his five key practices for inner work and self-acceptance in this interactive guidebook on maintaining daily mental wellness.

Buy on Amazon

Three Wild Dogs (and the truth)

by Markus Zusak

Release Date: January 21 2025

In this poignant, funny, and disarmingly honest memoir, one of the world’s most beloved storytellers, the #1 New York Times bestselling author of The Book Thief, tells of his family’s adoption of three troublesome rescue dogs—a charming and courageous love story about making even the most incorrigible of animals family.

Buy on Amazon

This Changes Everything

by Tyler Merritt

Release Date: January 14 2025

A cancer diagnosis caused Tyler Merritt—beloved author of I Take My Coffee Black—to realize that there was no time for anger, unforgiveness, foolishness, or lost friendships. None of us have any time to waste.

Buy on Amazon

The Good Mother Myth

by Nancy Reddy

Release Date: January 21 2025

Timely and thought-provoking, Nancy Reddy unpacks and debunks the bad ideas that have for too long defined what it means to be a “good” mom.

Buy on Amazon
